heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 09 November 2025, with precipitation totalling 47.89mm.  The rain fell at 24.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 144.8 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 34.3mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 09 November 2025, it lasted 144.8 hours and it delivered 47.89mm of rain at a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 06 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 3 so far this year, while the average is 3.6.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 0 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (213°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 128.2 mph on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 1.8°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.4 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.4 mm).

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 56.8m higher than yesterday, 30.6m lower than the past week, 44.0m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 557m and a high of 849m, averaging 728.4m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be low, possibly causing overcast or foggy conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, the air will feel dry and winds will be practically absent. Drizzle or light rain possible, cloud cover will be low, possibly causing overcast or foggy conditions, and it’s dim outside. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
